entity.name: Requirement
entity.description:
A Requirement is a type of
that is used to uniquely identify a requirement.
The term "requirement" is used here in the sense that term is used in systems engineering and similar industrial domains.
There may be many versions of a requirement (requirement_version). There may also be more than one domain-specific view of a given requirement_version (using the requirement_view_definition entity). The requirement entity is simply a placeholder for holding a unique requirement. Most associations and properties are defined at the requirement_view_definition level - i.e. in the context of a domain.
A requirement may be identified as "NOx emissions requirement", and uniquely identified as "Req2".
Systems engineering tools and organizations may use differing identification mechanisms. Multiple identifiers may be assigned to a requirement using the alias_identifier entity.

entity.name: Requirement_version
entity.description:
A Requirement_version is a type of
that identifies a particular version of a requirement.
This entity is used to record different versions of a requirement. In this case, the word "version" implies "revision" - i.e. a particular release of a requirement.
A given requirement might have versions 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and 2.0.
